approaches.name: Hardcoded Secrets
approaches.description: Secrets are embedded directly in application source code, exposing them to every developer and version control history.
redFlags: Rotation requires code changes and redeployment
Incident blast radius includes entire repository access

approaches.name: Shared Secret Files
approaches.description: Secrets live in JSON/YAML files that teams distribute manually, leading to coordination risk and data leakage through git history.
redFlags: Version history never forgets the first commit
Manual distribution leads to out-of-date copies
Difficult to enforce least-privilege access policies

approaches.name: Environment Variables
approaches.description: Secrets are injected at runtime through environment variables or integrated secret managers.
redFlags: Needs automation to rotate credentials regularly
